body_html:
Hey, thanks for the answer!

We checked and the operation is deterministic on CPU.
It still seems that the documentation of scatter_nd_update should reflect the fact that replacing multiple times the same index is non deterministic on GPU.

Something similar to scatter_nd : "WARNING: The order in which updates are applied is nondeterministic, so the output will be nondeterministic if indices contains duplicates."

Thanks again for your answer!

It still seems that the documentation of scatter_nd_update should reflect the fact that replacing multiple times the same index is non deterministic on GPU.

body:
Hey, thanks for the answer!

We checked and the operation is deterministic on CPU.
It still seems that the [documentation](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/scatter_nd_update) of scatter_nd_update should reflect the fact that replacing multiple times the same index is non deterministic on GPU.

Something similar to scatter_nd : "WARNING: The order in which updates are applied is nondeterministic, so the output will be nondeterministic if indices contains duplicates."

Thanks again for your answer!
